title: Boy injured after jumping from locked room; Police launch probe
byline: The Keselwatta Police have launched an investigation after a 12-year-old boy, who was forcibly locked inside a two-storey house, jumped out of a window and sustained serious injuries.

title: 5.2-magnitude earthquake hits California near San Diego
byline: A 5.2 earthquake rattled San Diego, California, and the surrounding area on Monday afternoon, according to the US Geological Survey.

title: CID refuses former President Ranil’s request to speak with Pillayan
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s request to speak with detained former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, alias Pillayan, has been refused by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Blue Origin completes historic all-female space tourism trip
byline: Blue Origin’s NS-31 mission completed a historic journey into space, carrying an all-female crew to the edge of the atmosphere, including entertainment reporter and partner of tycoon Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sánchez, journalist Gayler King, singer Katy Perry, and aerospace engineer Aisha Bowe.

title: China’s Xi urges Vietnam to oppose ’bullying’ as Trump mulls more tariffs
byline: China’s President Xi Jinping has called on Vietnam to oppose ’’unilateral bullying’’ to upkeep a global system of free trade - though he stopped short of naming the US.

title: Modi meets devoted follower who took a 14-year vow without footwear
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Rampal Kashyap, a man from Haryana’s Kaithal, who had taken an extraordinary vow 14 years ago — to not wear footwear until Modi became Prime Minister and he had met him in person.

title: State oil anointing ceremony to be held in Kandy tomorrow
byline: The annual State oil anointing ceremony, held in conjunction with the Sinhala and Tamil New Year, is scheduled to take place tomorrow (April 16) at 9:04 a.m. at the Sri Maha Natha Devalaya premises, located within the Sri Dalada Maligawa Square in Kandy.

title: EC calls for submission of legal documents on rejected nominations
byline: The Election Commission (EC) has requested secretaries and authorised representatives of political parties, as well as leaders of independent groups, to submit copies of any petitions and court judgments to the relevant District Election Offices.

title: Special bus, train services today and tomorrow
byline: Special bus operations will commence today in response to passenger demand, the National Transport Commission (NTC)  and the Railway Department announced.

title: 412 admitted to NHC following accidents on April 13 and 14; Six deaths reported
byline: A total of 412 individuals were admitted to the National Hospital Colombo (NHC) due to injuries sustained in various accidents reported on April 13 and 14, according to NHC Accidents Ward Director Dr. Indika Jagoda.

title: Police launch investigations into illegal street race in Homagama
byline: The Homagama Police have launched investigations into a street racing event captured in a video currently circulating on social media. The incident is believed to have taken place during the inauspicious time at dawn on New Year’s Day.

title: Gunman in Boossa prison officer’s murder arrested at BIA while attempting to flee
byline: The gunman who recently shot down the retired Superintendent of the Boossa Prison outside his residence was arrested this morning by officers of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) while attempting to flee the country through the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) using a fake passport.
